The Most Free

110

1118

Japanese Title:

自由になる

Romanized Title:

Jiyū ni Naru

Viz Title:

The Most Free

2024 Issue 30
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1118 is titled "The Most Free".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage, Vol 8: "The journey begins!!"

Short Summary[]

As the Iron Giant begins to sink beneath the ocean from the last attack, it wonders where Joy Boy is. The Five Elders decide their next target are both Lilith and Atlas. Luffy, Dorry, and Brogy arrive on the Giant Warrior Pirates' ship, and Sanji learns about the status of the Thousand Sunny. Mars attacks Luffy's group and after Luffy eats a meal from the giant's cook, he reactivates Gear 5. With Luffy's encouragement to help her, Bonney enters her Nika form as well. Hearing the Drums of Liberation causes the Iron Giant to reactivate.

Long Summary[]

The Iron Giant falls into the sea as a part of Dr. Vegapunk's message manages to cut through before going out again. As it sinks, the Iron Giant asks where Joy Boy went because it could sense he was there and it desperately really wanted to see him. As for the people over the world, they have all become confused by why the transmission ended before he could finish talking and why Dr. Vegapunk had to die in the first place. Some people correctly believe the World Government eliminated him because of the sins he said he committed, but others strongly believe the World Government would never do that, instead thinking Luffy had killed him because he was reported in the news to be holding him hostage.

Back on Egghead, the Five Elders ask York how many Vegapunks are still functioning, and she tells them that only two are left who are synched to Punk Records: Lilith and Atlas. She tells them where the both of them currently are and they move to eliminate them, revealing that even with Dr. Vegapunk dead, Punk Records will continue to grow, and all they need is York. The giants start setting sail as Dorry, Brogy, and Luffy finally arrive at the coast and jump on board. The Marines try to stop them, but Doll, Bluegrass, and the Sea Beast Weapon the latter is riding have all been turned into kids by Bonney, which she mocks them for. Sanji contacts Nami asking what her status is, and she tells him that they are getting ready to jump off the clouds, but if it looks like they will not reach the water, she will require his assistance, to which he replies he will save her, Robin, and Lilith without hesitation while letting the guys sink, much to Usopp's annoyance.

Mars flies over to the ship and breathes fire down on the giants, which they try to block with their shields. Mars ends up setting part of the ship ablaze, which the Giants try to extinguish. Mars declares he will not let any of them escape as the two Giant captains prepare to fight him, but Luffy returns to his Gear Fifth form after eating some of the giants' food to replenish his strength. He asks Bonney to help him, but she hesitates because of how powerful the Elders are. However, Luffy tells her that he has faith she can do it with her powers. This causes Bonney to remember how Luffy told her earlier that Gear Fifth is Luffy's form when he is free, and Bonney uses Distortion Future: Atashi Ga Ichiban Jiyuna Mirai, and transforms into her own version of Nika. The other Five Elders sense both of them and prepare to act, while the Iron Giant senses their presence as it continues to sink.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • The Iron Giant falls and sinks into the ocean.
    • The Iron Giant sought to meet up with Joy Boy again.
    • Vegapunk attempted to reveal the name of something during the transmission, but was unable to due to a malfunction.
  • The Five Elders start hunting for Lilith and Atlas.
    • Edison is no longer interfacing with Punk Records according to York, leaving his fate unknown.
  • Luffy, Dorry and Brogy make it to the ship of the Giant Warrior Pirates.
  • Bonney defeats Vice Admiral Doll and Vice Admiral Bluegrass.
  • Mars starts attacking the giants' ship from the sky.
    • Warcury and Ju Peter head toward the ship too.
    • Both are confirmed to possess Observation Haki.
  • With Gear 5 Luffy's encouragement, Bonney manages to transform into Nika as well.
  • Reacting to the Drums of Liberation once more, the sunken Iron Giant believes to have found Joy Boy.

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


I went to the GLAY 30th anniversary concert, which I drew the key art for. It was amazing! I felt it in my heart!


キービジュアルを描かせて頂いたGLAY30周年LIVE!!胸にきました最高でした!!

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.

'''Chapter 1118''' is titled "The Most Free".

==Cover Page==
[[Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage]], Vol 8: "The journey begins!!"

==Short Summary==
As the [[Emet|Iron Giant]] begins to sink beneath the ocean from the last attack, it wonders where [[Joy Boy]] is. The [[Five Elders]] decide their next target are both [[Vegapunk/Lilith|Lilith]] and [[Vegapunk/Atlas|Atlas]]. [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]], [[Dorry]], and [[Brogy]] arrive on the [[Giant Warrior Pirates]]' ship, and [[Sanji]] learns about the status of the [[Thousand Sunny]]. Mars attacks Luffy's group and after Luffy eats a meal from the giant's cook, he reactivates [[Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 5 Techniques|Gear 5]]. With Luffy's encouragement to help her, [[Jewelry Bonney|Bonney]] [[Toshi Toshi no Mi|enters]] her [[Nika]] form as well. Hearing the Drums of Liberation causes the Iron Giant to reactivate.

==Long Summary==
The [[Emet|Iron Giant]] falls into the sea as a part of [[Vegapunk|Dr. Vegapunk's]] message manages to cut through before going out again. As it sinks, the Iron Giant asks where [[Joy Boy]] went because it could sense he was there and it desperately really wanted to see him. As for the people over the [[world]], they have all become confused by why the transmission ended before he could finish talking and why Dr. Vegapunk had to die in the first place. Some people correctly believe the [[World Government]] eliminated him because of the sins he said he committed, but others strongly believe the World Government would never do that, instead thinking [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] had killed him because he was reported in the news to be holding him hostage.

Back on [[Egghead]], the [[Five Elders]] ask [[Vegapunk/York|York]] how many Vegapunks are still functioning, and she tells them that only two are left who are synched to [[Punk Records]]: [[Vegapunk/Lilith|Lilith]] and [[Vegapunk/Atlas|Atlas]]. She tells them where the both of them currently are and they move to eliminate them, revealing that even with Dr. Vegapunk dead, Punk Records will continue to grow, and all they need is York. The [[giants]] start setting sail as [[Dorry]], [[Brogy]], and Luffy finally arrive at the coast and jump on board. The [[Marines]] try to stop them, but [[Doll]], [[Bluegrass]], and the [[Sea Beast Weapons|Sea Beast Weapon]] the latter is [[Nori Nori no Mi|riding]] have all been [[Toshi Toshi no Mi|turned into kids]] by [[Jewelry Bonney|Bonney]], which she mocks them for. [[Sanji]] contacts [[Nami]] asking what her status is, and she tells him that they are getting ready to jump off the clouds, but if it looks like they will not reach the water, she will require his assistance, to which he replies he will save her, [[Nico Robin|Robin]], and Lilith without hesitation while letting the guys sink, much to [[Usopp|Usopp's]] annoyance.

[[Marcus Mars|Mars]] flies over to the ship and breathes fire down on the giants, which they try to block with their shields. Mars ends up setting part of the ship ablaze, which the Giants try to extinguish. Mars declares he will not let any of them escape as the two Giant captains prepare to fight him, but Luffy returns to his [[Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 5 Techniques|Gear Fifth]] form after eating some of the giants' food to replenish his strength. He asks Bonney to help him, but she hesitates because of how powerful the Elders are. However, Luffy tells her that he has faith she can do it with her powers. This causes Bonney to remember how Luffy told her earlier that Gear Fifth is Luffy's form when he is free, and Bonney uses ''Distortion Future: Atashi Ga Ichiban Jiyuna Mirai'', and transforms into her own version of Nika. The other Five Elders sense both of them and prepare to act, while the Iron Giant senses their presence as it continues to sink.
